pullrequest.title: Add ability to save worlds to SDFormat

content.raw:
I'll add this example:
If the uri is `https://example.org/1.0/test/models/Backpack` the path to the directory containing the sdf file (modelDir) will be: `$HOME/.ignition/fuel/example.org/test/models/Backpack/1/` and the basename of the directory is "1", which is the model version.

I have verified that this assumption will not always hold true. For example, if I move `$HOME/.ignition/fuel/example.org/test/models/Backpack/1/` to `/tmp/test/` and create a symlink `$HOME/.ignition/fuel/example.org/test/models/Backpack/1/ -> /tmp/test`, the filepath of the model.sdf will actually be `/tmp/test/model.sdf`. 

I don't know if anyone would want to do that though. I have used a symlink to point `$HOME/.ignition` to another hard disk to save space on my SSD, but I doubt that users would create a symlink at the level of a model's version directory.
